item.title: kendii add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kendii add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description:
"Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.
No one wants their life thrown into chaos. That is why a lot of people keep that threat under control, and are somehow capable of sustaining a house or a structure that is already rotten. They are the engineers of the superseded.
Other people think exactly the opposite: they surrender themselves without a second thought, hoping to find in passion the solutions to all their problems. They make the other person responsible for their happiness and blame them for their possible unhappiness. They are either euphoric because something marvelous has happened or depressed because something unexpected has just ruined everything.
Keeping passion at bay or surrendering blindly to it - which of these two attitudes is the least destructive?
I don't know." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kendii add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kendii add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "If one day I could get out of here, I would allow myself to be crazy. Everyone is indeed crazy, but the craziest are the ones who don't know they're crazy; they just keep repeating what others tell them to." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kendii add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Profound desire, true desire is the desire to be close to someone." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: kendii add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: kendii add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: kendii add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: kendii add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way." -- Jane Austen
